newsitem.title: USA: Raychem stock loses 15 percent of its value.
newsitem.headline: Raychem stock loses 15 percent of its value.

text.p: Plastic products manufacturer Raychem Corp. lost more than 15 percent of its value Thursday, one day after the company warned that currency fluctuations would continue to pressure its results.
Raychem slumped $12.50 to $68.875 on the New York Stock Exchange.

Although it made some cautionary comments, the Menlo Park, Calif.-based company Wednesday reported that its profits rose to $68.4 million on sales of $427.8 million in its fiscal third quarter ended on March 31, up from year ago earnings of $41.7 million on sales of $417.8 million.
On Thursday a spokesman said the company was surprised to see its stock fall so sharply since the comments made in its earnings report were consistent with what it had said previously.
"As far as we're concerned our prospects haven't changed," said spokesman Spencer Sias.

Raychem said in its earnings report that "adverse movements" in currency exchange rates lowered its income by about $5 million, and are expected to "continue exerting downward pressure on near-term results."
